Key Match Events: Pakistan won the coin toss and fielded first, taking advantage of the wet field conditions.
Pakistan dismissed Virat Kohli after just four runs.
Pakistan held India to 119 runs and took 10 wickets.
Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance restricted Pakistan to just three runs in one over and two runs in the next.
Pakistan needed 32 runs from the last 21 balls, then 26 from 16, and finally 12 from 2 balls.
India won the match with a final score of 119-113/7.
Post-Match Reflections: The crowd, mostly India fans, experienced total joy at the match taking place.
Amad, a Pakistan fan, expressed that the match meant everything to him and mentioned celebrations in Pakistan.
Baljit Bhatt, an India fan, highlighted the significance of Jasprit Bumrah's bowling performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the T20 World Cup, co-hosted by the U.S.
The game experienced a rain delay before it started.
The match took place on Long Island, in front of a crowd of first- and second-generation Americans.
